title: Sketch Class: Color
short_description: Learn how to unlock the power of color in your drawings. Inspired by the exhibition Weaving beyond the Bauhaus and works from the museum's collection, this course allows for an in-depth exploration of color juxtaposition and theory. This program is for people ages 16 and up, is appropriate for those who have taken a Beginners Sketching workshop or who have some previous drawing experience. All materials will be provided.
description:
Learn how to unlock the power of color in your drawings. Inspired by the exhibition Weaving beyond the Bauhaus and works from the museum's collection, this course allows for an in-depth exploration of color juxtaposition and theory.

This course is appropriate for those who have taken a Beginners Sketching workshop or who have some previous drawing experience.

About the Instructor 
Barbara Fitzpatrick is a painter, teacher, and architect, with particular interests in color, light, and form. She trained as a painter at the Academie de Port-Royale in Paris and the Art Students League of New York. She has had several solo shows in New York and teaches painting and drawing in her studio, at the Art Institute, and through regular classes in Hyde Park. Her architecture practice with Tipping Fitzpatrick Architecture and Design is focused on the restoration of late 19th- and early 20th-century homes in the Chicago area. She received a BA in art history from Williams College and an MArch from the University of Illinois at Chicago.

See all upcoming sketch classes and workshops. For additional information, please call (312) 443-3680 or email museum-programs@artic.edu. 

Persons with disabilities who would like to request an accessibility accommodation for an Art Institute program are encouraged to send an email to access@artic.edu two weeks in advance of the program.
